title: RE: Nikki Sykes Records Request

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Mississippi Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

RE:	       Nikki Sykes
DOB:	08/21/1984
SSN:	427-55-7937

Specifically, I am requesting copies of all records, reports, memorandums, correspondence, complaints, incident reports, investigative reports, accident reports, interview reports, etc… relating to the above listed individual generated and/or maintained by your department

This request is being made as part of a standard insurance claims investigation and for no other purpose.

If you are unable to provide any portion of the records requested, please cite the specific section of the Act under which you claim an exemption.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 7 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sequoya Barlow

title: Untitled

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records sufficient to identify the number of people, other than President Trump, that Attorney General Pam Bondi or anyone acting at her direction notified that their name appears in any Epstein documents or files. I don't need every record, and I don't need the names.  I'm just looking for documents that would show me how many people.  For example, if a list exists, I would accept a list in which each name is redacted, which would allow me to ascertain the total number.  Or if notifications were made by letter or email, you could provide me those communications, again with names redacted.  I'm open to other approaches.  Because I am only looking for documents sufficient to show, and because there may not even be any other such people, I request that you do not start by conducting an electronic search, but instead simply contact Ms. Bondi or the appropriate person on her staff to ask whether there have been any such notifications.  If they tell you there have not, I would not ask you to conduct any further searches.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Topic

title: E & A Occupancy + Fire Sprinkler Information (City Of Frisco)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

I respectfully request an electronic, parcel-level extract containing current Group E (Educational) and Group A (Assembly) occupancies and associated fire-sprinkler information for all parcels within the jurisdiction: 

Please provide one CSV with the following columns (your native field names are fine):
- Parcel identifier (APN / PIN / BBL)
• Site address (street #, street, city, ZIP)
• Latitude & longitude
• Internal building / permit ID
• Year built
• Floor area (sq ft)
• Number of stories
• Current IBC occupancy code (E, A-1…A-5)
• Occupancy description
• Fire-sprinkler present (Yes / No / Unknown)
• Date of last fire-sprinkler inspection (if tracked)
• Owner name & mailing address (if stored)

If any field is not maintained, please note that rather than withholding the entire record.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

David Cavise

title: Seeking records related to elected officials expense account, acct. #567700

communications.subject: The Missouri Sunshine Law Request: Seeking records related to elected officials expense account, acct. #567700
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Missouri Sunshine Law, I hereby request the following records:

Please locate and produce to me an electronic copy of any documents and/or other records generated or received since January 1, 2023, that contain the phrase "elected official expense account." My understanding is that the documents I am hoping to review are related to a financial account numbered 567700, so it may be useful to include that number as a search term, either separately or in connection with the phrase "elected official expense account."

The records I am requesting are open public records within the definition of § 610.010(6). I am not aware of any provision of law that allows for the closure or withholding of these records. If a copy of these records is kept in an electronic format, I ask that you provide them to me in that electronic format. If either you or the public governmental body you represent contends that the documents I have requested – or any portion of those documents – are exempt from disclosure under Missouri’s Sunshine Law, I ask you to comply with § 610.024, RSMo., and make available to me for review any part of the records that you believe to be not exempt. Additionally, I hereby rely upon § 610.023.4, RSMo., and ask you to provide a written statement identifying any basis upon which you consider the records to be exempt from disclosure, including the specific provision(s) of law that you believe to justify denying my access to those documents.

This request must "be acted upon as soon as possible, but in no event later than the end of the third business day following the date the request is received." § 610.023.3, RSMo. If you do not agree to make the requested records available within three days of receiving this request, I demand a "detailed explanation of the cause for further delay.”

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Glenn Burleigh

title: John Michael "Ozzy" Osbourne (3 December 1948 – 22 July 2025)

communications.subject: Freedom of Information Act Request: John Michael "Ozzy" Osbourne (3 December 1948 – 22 July 2025)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

Records mentioning, relating to, or generated as a result of investigation or inquiry into heavy metal musician John Michael "Ozzy" Osbourne (3 December 1948 – 22 July 2025) and/or his band, Black Sabbath. His death is widely-known and widely reported; as such, privacy concerns under FOIA Exemptions 6 and 7 are voided, as are any concerns under the Privacy Act. For example, you may find his New York Times obituary at the following link: https://www.nytimes.com/2025/07/22/arts/music/ozzy-osbourne-dead.html

Please conduct a search of the Central Records System, including but not limited to the Electronic Surveillance (ELSUR) Indices, the Microphone Surveillance (MISUR) Indices, the Physical Surveillance (FISUR) Indices, and the Technical Surveillance (TESUR) Indices, for both main-file records and cross-reference records of both HQ and all field offices for all relevant names, agencies, organizations, companies and events including but not limited to those cited in the previous paragraphs and/or links as well as a cross-reference with the Southern Poverty Law Center to include any information provided by the SPLC. My request includes but is not limited to 137, 157, 176, 177, 183, 184, 188, and 214 files. If previously released records are available, then I request a rolling release consisting of those records while additional records are located and processed for release.

If any part of these documents are exempt from disclosure, please be sure to review and release all reasonably segregable nonexempt portions of responsive documents, as the FOIA requires.

I request that I be properly classified as a media requester. I am an assistant editor at Reason Magazine who has written numerous articles on topics of public interest, and I am requesting these documents in an editorial capacity. Please contact me if you have any questions about my media status.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Matthew Petti

communications.communication:
--- Please respond above this line --- 
  
   
  
 
RE: FOIL Records Request of July 23, 2025, Reference # R012310-072325 
Dear Planning Planning, 
The New York State Police received a FOIL request from you on July 23, 2025. 
Your request has been forwarded to the appropriate program area(s) to identify documents that are responsive to your request and which may be made available pursuant to all applicable provisions of the Freedom of Information Law. 
A determination as to whether your request is granted or denied will be reached in approximately 120 business days or we will notify you in writing if the responsible program area(s) should require additional time to locate, assemble and review documents that may be responsive to your request. 
Please be advised that this additional time is required to appropriately complete your request due to the high volume of record requests currently being processed by this agency. Additionally, the volume of records and the manner in which they are maintained may require time-consuming searches and retrieval efforts.  Further, as the records maintained by this law enforcement agency are generally sensitive in nature, thorough review of any responsive records is necessary to prevent the disclosure of confidential and/or sensitive information. Finally, this agency processes requests in the order they are received and requests that are particularly voluminous or complex may require additional time to complete. The body worn camera portion of your request will be processed in the order in which it was received.  We are currently experiencing a backlog and appreciate your patience in this matter.  If the requested footage is located, you will receive correspondence via e-mail from no reply@evidence.com . 
Please note that, pursuant to Article 6 of the Public Officers Law, a charge may be applied to your request, including the actual cost of the medium used to respond to your Freedom of Information Law request and/or other related costs. When responsive records have been identified, you will be informed of any cost and how payment should be made. 
As we have acknowledged your request, please refrain from submitting duplicate requests for the same records through GovQA.  If you need a status update on your request, or were asked to resubmit due to an ongoing investigation, please reach out to us.  To submit additional information or inquire about the status of your request, you can send a message through your GovQA portal account or call us at (518) 464-7100 and select option #4. 
Sincerely, 
New York State Police 
1220 Washington Avenue, Bldg. 22 
Albany, NY 12226-2252

title: Public Records Request – BWC  Footage – Arrest of Christine Turner and Christina Yacalis (6/20/25)

communications.subject: New York Freedom of Information Law Request: Public Records Request – BWC  Footage – Arrest of Christine Turner and Christina Yacalis (6/20/25)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern,

Pursuant to the New York Freedom of Information Law (FOIL), I am requesting access to and copies of all available body-worn camera (BWC), dash camera, and in-vehicle camera footage related to the arrest of Christine Turner and Christina Yacalis on or around June 20, 2025, in Binghamton, New York.

According to public reports, deputies from the Broome County Sheriff's Office responded to a stolen vehicle report originating from the Town of Maine on June 18. On June 20, deputies located the vehicle—a 2023 Hyundai Santa Fe SUV—on Sturges Street in Binghamton. The suspect, Christine Turner, fled from deputies, leading them through several city streets, including Bevier Street, State Street, and Route 363, before being stopped near Frederick Street.

Turner allegedly resisted commands and had to be forcibly removed from the vehicle. A passenger, Christina Yacalis, was also taken into custody. A subsequent search of the vehicle uncovered drugs including cocaine, fentanyl, and Alprazolam.

I am requesting any and all video that captures:

Initial vehicle stop

Pursuit and traffic violations

Officer commands and suspect responses

Use of force, if any

Arrest and detainment of both individuals

In-vehicle/backseat footage of transport, if applicable

If multiple deputies were on scene with BWC or vehicle cams, I request footage from all involved officers. If any portion of the footage is redacted or withheld, please cite the specific exemption being applied and release all non-exempt portions.

I request the records be provided electronically, and I am willing to pay reasonable duplication costs. Please notify me in advance if there will be any fees.

Thank you for your assistance.

title: Wisconsin Open Records Request – BWC Footage - Arrest of Andi Anthony (12/9/24)

communications.subject: Wisconsin Open Records Act Request: Wisconsin Open Records Request – BWC Footage - Arrest of Andi Anthony (12/9/24)
communications.communication:
Dear Records Custodian,

Pursuant to the Wisconsin Open Records Law, I am requesting access to and copies of all records related to an incident that occurred on December 9, 2024, involving a vehicle crash into a house following a failed traffic stop in Grand Chute, WI.

According to public reports, around 2:00 p.m., a Grand Chute police officer attempted a traffic stop in the 4500 block of West Capitol Drive, after which the vehicle fled eastbound at a high rate of speed and ultimately crashed into a home in the 3100 block of the same road. Two suspects reportedly fled on foot and were apprehended with assistance from a police K-9 unit. Both suspects were injured and transported to a hospital. The Wisconsin State Patrol, Outagamie County Sheriff’s Office, Appleton Police, Grand Chute Fire, and Gold Cross Ambulance were also reported as assisting agencies.

Specifically, I am requesting:

All body-worn camera (BWC) footage from Grand Chute officers involved in or responding to the incident.

All in-car/dash camera footage from patrol vehicles.

Any photos, civilian video or reports related to damage to the residence struck by the vehicle.

If responsive records are held by assisting agencies (e.g., Wisconsin State Patrol), kindly indicate that in your response so I may redirect the request.

I prefer to receive these materials in electronic format. If fees apply, please inform me of the total in advance.

Thank you for your attention to this request.

communications.subject: Your City of Albuquerque public records request #25-9844 has been submitted.
communications.communication:
City of Albuquerque ************************************************************************ Your record request #25-9844 has been submitted successfully. Greetings: We have received your request for public records and will begin processing your request. This correspondence is intended to acknowledge your request and alert you that it may take up to fifteen days to process your request. NMSA 1978 14-2-8(D). We will be in contact with you as we process your request if we need additional information or if it appears that your request is excessively burdensome and broad. Additionally, please let us know if you have or later acquire documents relating to your request and upload the records into NextRequest. Such additional information has proven to be a useful resource in identifying, locating, and producing additional records. Planning /Fire/Environmental Health Department Records: If you are requesting records from the Planning, Fire, or Environmental Health Departments, please make sure to review City of Albuquerque Info Connect. That website may provide you with the information you are seeking regarding current development projects and other matters. Police Department: Please be advised, if you are requesting lapel and/or 911 audio from the Albuquerque Police Department (APD), your request may take a significant amount of time to review and provide the records. In lieu of the 911 audio, my office can provide the Computer Aided Dispatch (CAD). The CAD provides information of when the call was received, when and what officers were dispatched, and a description of what happens throughout the incident. In addition, please keep in mind a 5 minute lapel video can take up to 20 minutes to review depending on the type of redactions that are necessary to complete. We will be in contact to discuss ways to narrow your request but you are also welcome to contact us to discuss narrowing options. If you have or later acquire documents relating to your request, please let us know and upload the records into NextRequest. Such additional information has proven to be a useful resource in identifying, locating, and producing additional records. Please do not hesitate to contact us if you would like to know the status of your request, and please communicate all questions and status updates via NextRequest. title: Public Records Request – BWC Footage - Arrest of Michaela Lynch (3/3/25)

communications.subject: Arkansas Freedom of Information Act Request: Public Records Request – BWC Footage - Arrest of Michaela Lynch (3/3/25)
communications.communication:
Dear Custodian of Records,

Pursuant to the Arkansas Freedom of Information Act § 25-19-101 et seq., 

I am requesting public records relating to an incident that occurred on March 3, 2025 at approximately 12:10 AM and led to the arrest of Michaela Lynch. The incident occurred near Highway 264 and Old Wire Road, and a subsequent stop was made at a pasture near a barbed wire fence following an attempted flight from law enforcement.

The investigation was initiated by Deputy Nathan Smith of the Benton County Sheriff’s Office, and ultimately resulted in arrests including that of Michaela Lynch, who was located hiding approximately 30 yards south of the vehicle.

Please provide the following records:

in-vehicle  and/or body-worn camera footage

I am requesting digital copies of these records. If there are any fees associated with this request, please inform me before fulfilling it. Should any part of the request be unclear or too broad, I would appreciate guidance on how to narrow it.

Thank you for your time and attention.

title: Coupefill AFFF PFAS MDL Class Action Notice Request

communications.subject: Washington Public Records Act Request: Coupefill AFFF PFAS MDL Class Action Notice Request
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Washington Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

Dear sirs, although I previously submitted a request and sent payment, you rejected my request because according to you payment was received after your self-imposed deadline of July 7, 0206.  Accordingly, I submit this request (again) for all records, including without limitation correspondence, class and summary notices, claim forms and addendums, correspondence, and payments, checks and vouchers related to or in connection with the proposed or approved settlement of the  In Re: Aqueous Film-Forming Foams Products Liability Litigation, MDL No. 2:18-mn-2873-RMG and the related class action case of City of Camden, et al., v. 3M Company, No. 2:23-cv-03147-RMG pending in the multi-district litigation in the United States District Court for the District of South Carolina.  If you have any further issues, questions, or comments please contact me through this site with a copy please to lawoffice@rlteel.com.  You may also telephone me at 718-570-7509 with any questions you may have.  Please apply the prior payment to this request.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Robert Teel

The contents of the training given on September 17th, 2024 at  the Manassas, VA Verizon Auditorium and developed by the George Washington University’s Program on Extremism and Combat Antisemitism Movement. I also request all communications detailing the planning for this training; the list of federal, state, and local law enforcement agencies and/or officers at the training; and any contracts that show the amount of money paid to the Combat Antisemitism Movement and the Program on Extremism for this training. Reference to this training is here: https://www.dcjs.virginia.gov/training-events/george-washington-university-program-extremism

communications.subject: Virginia Freedom of Information Act Request: Untitled
communications.communication:
This office is in receipt of your request which we received on July 22, 2025, made in accordance with the Virginia Freedom of Information Act (Virginia Code § 2.2-3700 et seq.), in which you are requesting "The contents of the training given on September 17th, 2024 at the Manassas, VA Verizon Auditorium and developed by the George Washington University's Program on Extremism and Combat Antisemitism Movement. I also request all communications detailing the planning for this training; the list of federal, state, and local law enforcement agencies and/or officers at the training; and any contracts that show the amount of money paid to the Combat Antisemitism Movement and the Program on Extremism for this training. Reference to this training is here: https://www.dcjs.virginia.gov/training-events/george-washington-university-program-extremism".
Please be advised that it is not possible to provide the requested records within the five working days required by FOIA because of the review process required for this request. Therefore, we are invoking subsection B 4 of §2.2-3704 to provide us with seven additional working days to respond to your request.

As a reminder, please send your emails related to FOIA requests in the future to this email address:  FOIA@dcjs.virginia.gov

Thank you.

communications.subject: [External Message Added] Washoe County, NV public records request #25-1429
communications.communication:
Washoe County, NV ************************************************************************ A message was sent to you regarding record request #25-1429: Greetings, This is a confirmation of your public records request received by the Washoe County Manager’s Office. Your request has been routed to the appropriate staff within Washoe County. Washoe County typically processes requests in the order of receipt. The time it takes to respond to a request will vary depending on the complexity of the request and any backlog of requests already pending. A simple request can be processed faster than one that is complex. Simple requests are typically more targeted and seek fewer pages of records. Complex requests typically seek a high volume of material or require additional steps to process. Requests for communications require coordination of several departments and review of each record for confidentiality and privilege. Please consider focusing or narrowing the request in such a manner as to maximize expeditious processing. Due to the high volume of public records requests received and the complexity of your request, it is expected that you will receive documents or an update on or before August 21st, 2025. Sincerely,   Washoe311 Public Records Requests  ************************************************************************ Questions about your request?
